note.p: Death: Sceaux, near Paris, France (23 May 1857)
Research Field: Mathematics, mathematical physics, celestial mechanics
Education: Ecole Polytechnique, Paris (1805), Ecole des gronts et chaussees, Paris (1807)
Career: Engineer; took up Mathematics and was appointed to Ecole Polytechnique (gave up 1830); Professor of Mathematical physics, University of Turin (1831); tutor to Duke of Bordeaux (1833)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1857-1859 vol 9 pp 44-49
References: W K Hayman, 'Complex Integration', review of Frank Smithies, Cauchy and the Creation of Complex Function Theory in NR 1999 vol 53 pp 173-174
Notes: DSB gives alternative death date of 22 May.
